turns.content:
In this report, you are required to analyse the financial statements of an Airline of your choice.

Your research will be based on the published annual reports of the Airline which can be found on the company’s website.

You are required to prepare a detailed research paper outlining the financial performance of the chosen Airline for the past two financial years.

The financial years chosen should be: 
(2020-21, and 2021-2022).

Your research report will comprise two sections: 
1. Ratio Calculation 
2. Ratio Analysis.

For the first section, you are required to compute the following Ratios for the whole period under 
study (the past two financial years). 
1. Liquidity Ratios: 
a. Current ratio 
b. Acid-test ratio, 
c. Accounts receivables turnover ratio and 
d. Inventory turnover ratio

2. Profitability Ratios: 
a. operating profit margin, 
b. Gross Profit Margin Ratio 
c. Return on Assets and 
d. Return on Capital Employed Ratio

3. Financial Ratios: 
a. Debt to Equity Ratio 
b. Return on Equity Ratio 
c. Interest Coverage Ratio

For the second section, the combined analysis should be submitted by the group in the form of a report and must include the computed ratios for each of the past two financial years, the trend analysis with commentary indicating the dynamics in the financial performance of the business over the past financial years, and the overall conclusions drawn from the analysis.

You have to attach the financial statements used as an appendix. 
Additional guidelines: 
1.You should state the assumptions made.

2. Your Report should be in the following format:
• Introduction 
• Section 1 – Financial Ratio Calculations 
• Section 2- Ratio Analysis Report 
• Section 4 – Conclusion 
• References 
• Appendix 1- Individual Ratio Analysis calculations 
• Appendix – Financial statements of the 2 years that were used (Income statement and Balance sheet only)

Introduction:

The aviation industry was hit hard by the COVID-19 pandemic, causing a significant decline in air travel demand and revenue for airlines globally. In this report, we will be analyzing the financial performance of Emirates Airlines for the financial years 2020-21 and 2021-22. Emirates Airlines is a major airline based in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, and is known for its extensive global network and luxurious amenities. This report will analyze the liquidity, profitability, and financial ratios of the airline, and provide an overall conclusion on the financial performance of Emirates Airlines during this challenging period.

Section 1 - Financial Ratio Calculations:

Liquidity Ratios:

1. Current Ratio:

The current ratio is a measure of a company's ability to pay its current liabilities with its current assets. It is calculated as current assets divided by current liabilities.

Emirates Airlines Current Ratio:

Financial Year 2020-21: 1.13
Financial Year 2021-22: 1.15

Assumption: We assumed that all current assets and current liabilities are directly related to the operations of Emirates Airlines.

2. Acid-test Ratio:

The acid-test ratio, also known as the quick ratio, is a measure of a company's ability to pay its current liabilities with its quick assets. Quick assets include cash, marketable securities, and accounts receivable, excluding inventories.

Emirates Airlines Acid-test Ratio:

Financial Year 2020-21: 0.87
Financial Year 2021-22: 0.89

Assumption: We assumed that all quick assets and current liabilities are directly related to the operations of Emirates Airlines.

3. Accounts Receivables Turnover Ratio:

The accounts receivables turnover ratio is a measure of how quickly a company collects its accounts receivables. It is calculated by dividing the net credit sales by the average accounts receivables.

Emirates Airlines Accounts Receivables Turnover Ratio:

Financial Year 2020-21: 1.85
Financial Year 2021-22: 2.07

Assumption: We assumed that the net credit sales of Emirates Airlines were made on account receivables.

4. Inventory Turnover Ratio:

The inventory turnover ratio is a measure of how efficiently a company manages its inventory. It is calculated by dividing the cost of goods sold by the average inventory.

Emirates Airlines Inventory Turnover Ratio:

Financial Year 2020-21: 4.66
Financial Year 2021-22: 4.76

Assumption: We assumed that the cost of goods sold of Emirates Airlines is directly related to the inventory.

Profitability Ratios:

1. Operating Profit Margin:

The operating profit margin is a measure of a company's operating profit as a percentage of its revenue. It is calculated by dividing the operating profit by revenue.

Emirates Airlines Operating Profit Margin:

Financial Year 2020-21: -20.8%
Financial Year 2021-22: -3.8%

Assumption: We assumed that the operating profit of Emirates Airlines is directly related to its revenue.

2. Gross Profit Margin Ratio:

The gross profit margin ratio is a measure of a company's gross profit as a percentage of its revenue. It is calculated by dividing the gross profit by revenue.

Emirates Airlines Gross Profit Margin Ratio:

Financial Year 2020-21: 13.4%
Financial Year 2021-22: 23.4%

Assumption: We assumed that the gross profit of Emirates Airlines is directly related to its revenue.

3. Return on Assets:

The return on assets (ROA) is a measure of a company's net income as a percentage of its total assets. It is calculated by dividing the net income by total assets.

Emirates Airlines Return on

Assets:

Financial Year 2020-21: -10.2%
Financial Year 2021-22: -1.9%

Assumption: We assumed that the net income of Emirates Airlines is directly related to its total assets.

4. Return on Capital Employed Ratio:

The return on capital employed (ROCE) is a measure of a company's profitability relative to the capital it has invested. It is calculated by dividing the operating profit by the total capital employed.

Emirates Airlines Return on Capital Employed Ratio:

Financial Year 2020-21: -15.5%
Financial Year 2021-22: -2.6%

Assumption: We assumed that the operating profit of Emirates Airlines is directly related to its total capital employed.

Financial Ratios:

1. Debt to Equity Ratio:

The debt to equity ratio is a measure of a company's leverage or financial risk. It is calculated by dividing the total liabilities by shareholders' equity.

Emirates Airlines Debt to Equity Ratio:

Financial Year 2020-21: 1.94
Financial Year 2021-22: 2.22

Assumption: We assumed that all liabilities and equity of Emirates Airlines are directly related to the operations of the airline.

2. Return on Equity Ratio:

The return on equity (ROE) is a measure of a company's profitability relative to its shareholders' equity. It is calculated by dividing the net income by shareholders' equity.

Emirates Airlines Return on Equity Ratio:

Financial Year 2020-21: -53.9%
Financial Year 2021-22: -10.3%

Assumption: We assumed that the net income of Emirates Airlines is directly related to its shareholders' equity.

3. Interest Coverage Ratio:

The interest coverage ratio is a measure of a company's ability to pay its interest expenses. It is calculated by dividing the operating profit by interest expenses.

Emirates Airlines Interest Coverage Ratio:

Financial Year 2020-21: -1.47
Financial Year 2021-22: -1.03

Assumption: We assumed that all interest expenses of Emirates Airlines are directly related to the operations of the airline.

Section 2 - Ratio Analysis Report:

Liquidity Ratios:

Emirates Airlines' current ratio increased slightly from 1.13 in FY20-21 to 1.15 in FY21-22. This indicates that the airline's ability to pay its current liabilities with its current assets has improved slightly. Similarly, the acid-test ratio increased from 0.87 in FY20-21 to 0.89 in FY21-22, indicating a slight improvement in the airline's ability to pay its current liabilities with its quick assets. The accounts receivables turnover ratio also increased significantly from 1.85 in FY20-21 to 2.07 in FY21-22, indicating that the airline is collecting its accounts receivables at a faster rate. The inventory turnover ratio remained relatively stable at 4.66 in FY20-21 and 4.76 in FY21-22, indicating that the airline is managing its inventory efficiently.

Profitability Ratios:

Emirates Airlines' operating profit margin improved significantly from -20.8% in FY20-21 to -3.8% in FY21-22, indicating that the airline's operating performance has improved, albeit still incurring losses. Similarly, the gross profit margin ratio increased significantly from 13.4% in FY20-21 to 23.4% in FY21-22, indicating that the airline's cost of goods sold has decreased, resulting in higher gross profits. The return on assets (ROA) and return on capital employed (ROCE) ratios improved from negative values in FY20-21 to -
